Title: TikTok LIVE Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities
The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touch-points to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages (Python is highly preferred)

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.​


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.​
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.​
​
Diversity & Inclusion​
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.​
Show more
HTML:
Responsibilities
The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touch-points to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages (Python is highly preferred)

About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and we also have offices in New York City, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.​


Why Join Us
Inspiring creativity is at the core of TikTok's mission. Our innovative product is built to help people authentically express themselves, discover and connect – and our global, diverse teams make that possible. Together, we create value for our communities, inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we work towards every day.​
We strive to do great things with great people. We lead with curiosity, humility, and a desire to make impact in a rapidly growing tech company. Every challenge is an opportunity to learn and innovate as one team. We're resilient and embrace challenges as they come. By constantly iterating and fostering an "Always Day 1" mindset, we achieve meaningful breakthroughs for ourselves, our company, and our users. When we create and grow together, the possibilities are limitless. Join us.​
​
Diversity & Inclusion​
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.​

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are




Money, it's a big problem for many. Our mission is to give everyone access to a richer life, helping everyone to enjoy a happier, healthier relationship with money. We've already helped over a million people by giving them the tools they need to achieve their goals, feel good and do a little better — from building their credit scores to growing their savings, to just understanding how it all works. Rapid experimentation to find what works, and learn as much as we can, is at the heart of our growth story.




What you'll do




As a Data Analyst, you know that it’s not just about the data we have, but what we do with it that counts. In this key role within the data team, you will use your analytical and critical skills to shape our commercial strategy while helping to scale and strengthen our team. You'll transform complex business problems into questions, insights and actions that will underpin decisions across business units. You’ll also collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, engineering and finance teams to improve customer engagement and maximise our revenue.




You will:

Play a role in continuous improvement by identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities for further optimisation
Find the “so what?” in the results, and highlight what we could seek to learn or ask next.
Provide high quality monitoring and reporting on the performance of campaigns and experiments
Work closely with squads to formulate testable hypotheses that are based on insights derived from your data analysis.
Support the wider data team to answer the big questions that feed into company strategy.




Who you are

You are motivated by a love of your work and a connection to the mission of the business.
You are a strong collaborator, communicator and team player, with experience of leveraging the skills and knowledge around you in the wider business to find the answer.
You have good presentation skills, and enjoy sharing what you’ve found in a way that’s easy to understand.
You are full of curiosity and passionate about continuous learning, especially when it comes to tools and trends that allow you to make an impact with data.
You have a grasp of statistical methods and their practical application, such as significance testing or linear regression.
You have some experience using SQL and you are excited about developing your technical skills. It’s a bonus if you have used Python or R for data manipulation and analysis.
You relentlessly look beyond the data to find the “so what?” in the analysis.
You have experience working in fast-paced teams where ideas flow freely from everyone.




Benefits

Competitive salary - based on your level of experience
Annual bonus
£500 richer life fund
25 days holiday plus bank holidays, a day off in your birthday month, variable Christmas closure
Enhanced parental leave package
Pirkx employee reward scheme; telephone GP, free counselling, high street discounts and more
Hybrid working with access to our Bristol office and access co-working spaces nationwide
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Are you passionate about turning data into clear, actionable insights?




Do you enjoy working with a variety of tools to solve business challenges?




Ready to join a leading retailer where your work will make a tangible impact?




MacGregor Black is partnering with a Leading Retailer on the search for a Data Analyst. This is a hybrid role based in the London area.




As Data Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights across a wide range of datasets. Using tools such as Databricks, Tableau, Looker Studio, Amplitude, and DBT, you will extract, transform, and analyse data to support key business functions.

You will collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs, generate reports, and provide actionable insights that influence business decisions. Your remit will include analysing sales, customer, marketing, and operational data, as well as supporting digital analytics when required.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Extraction & Analysis

Write SQL queries in Databricks.
Support stakeholders with key business questions.
Handle ad-hoc and recurring data requests.
Validate data to ensure accuracy.
Use GitHub via VSCode to manage code repositories.




Delivering Insights & Reporting

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports (Tableau, Looker Studio).
Define KPIs and track business performance.
Present insights to stakeholders clearly and effectively.
3. Supporting Digital Analytics & Marketing Data
Work with web analytics tools (Amplitude, Contentsquare, Medallia).
Integrate digital data with business datasets.
Support teams with self-serve analytics tools.




Performance Measurement & Business Support

Develop performance frameworks.
Identify trends and provide recommendations.
Assist with forecasting, target setting, and promotional analysis.




Data Governance & Optimisation

Conduct QA checks for data accuracy.
Improve data architecture and integrate new data sources.
Apply advanced analytics using SQL, Databricks, and other tools.




What are we looking for?




2+ years’ experience in a similar role.
Strong analytical mindset with a passion for uncovering insights.
Skilled in SQL and data visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI).
Familiarity with Amplitude/Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics.
Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Experience in commercial analysis (target building, forecast setting, promotional analysis).
Strong communication skills.
Awareness of digital marketing.
A Level/degree in Mathematics or STEM.
Knowledge of statistics.
Python experience for data analysis.
Hands-on experience with dbt.
Awareness of data governance best practices.




This is a hybrid role requiring at least three days per week onsite.

Salary: £40,000 – £45,000




For more information, please contact Gabby Zachrisson today.

Title: Data Analyst, EMEA Supply Chain Operations – 1 Year Fixed Contract
Description:
Job Description

Join our dynamic team at LEGO and play a pivotal role in transforming our EMEA Supply Chain Operations through innovative data solutions and process automation that drive efficiency and visibility!


Core Responsibilities





Develop impactful reporting through effective data sourcing, transformation, and visualization to provide operational insights that drive actionable outcomes.
Implement digital process automation in line with Citizen Development guidelines, to enhance operational efficiency in Supply Chain Operations.
Ensure data quality and compliance across all reporting and optimization initiatives by applying data governance principles.
Follow established standards for robust, documented, and supportable solutions with effective change management.
Collaborate with operational teams to gather user stories, assess business goals, risks, and anticipated value.
Share processes and technical solutions to support the definition of global standards, enhancing value as One LEGO Team.
Promote digital capabilities by educating and empowering teams with digital skills.
Build understanding of Global Supply Chain processes and leverage data solutions to improve operational performance.




Play your part in our team succeeding

By joining EMEA Supply Chain Operations, you will have the opportunity to work with our talented team and play an active part in putting our products into the hands of children across EMEA.

The EMEA Supply Chain Operations Technology function is part of the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization, and supports and optimizes our operations, providing accurate, engaging and timely information to operational teams to support delivery of our priorities.

Acting as functional experts, the team supports a range of digital solutions, from collaborative creation of user stories to development, delivery and support of data solutions.

To support our digitalization journey, the function also plays an active role in building digital awareness and capability across the EMEA Supply Chain Operations organization.

Do you have what it takes?





Advanced expertise in Microsoft Power BI (incl. DAX), with strong capabilities in complex data transformation beyond visualization.
Advanced expertise in SQL or Python.
Experience across a range of data tools and platforms (such as Databricks, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Platform, for flexible data sourcing, transformation, visualization, and automation).
Proven analytical skills with Agile problem-solving experience, exceptional attention to detail, and a proactive, driven approach.
A strong communicator,that is able to translate technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Committed to building inclusive, collaborative team environments.
Preferred Supply Chain exposure, Databricks, Alteryx and SAP experience.




Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance for this position.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Student Accommodation
Description:
A leading student accommodation company is seeking a dynamic and motivated Data Analyst to support key business functions across revenue management, marketing, sales, and commercial strategy. This role offers an exciting opportunity for an analytically-minded professional to work cross-functionally, delivering data-driven insights that inform strategic decisions and drive performance across the organisation.

Reporting to the Head of Sales and working closely with the business systems team, the successful candidate will bring a strong analytical mindset, solid technical skills, and ideally, experience within the purpose-built student accommodation (PBSA) or wider property sector.




Key Responsibilities

Market Intelligence
Collects and analyses market data on rental levels, occupancy rates, and sector trends within the PBSA market and related areas such as Build-to-Rent (BTR) and Houses in Multiple Occupation (HMO).
Conducts market and competitor analysis to inform pricing strategies and revenue planning.

Data Analysis

Supports pricing decisions by modelling demand scenarios, benchmarking competitors, and identifying seasonal trends.
Forecasts rental revenue, uncovers growth opportunities, and supports the development of leasing strategies.
Works with the sales team to refine rental proposals and optimise rent-setting approaches.
Monitors KPIs, highlights data anomalies, and recommends appropriate actions.
Assists in analysing data during the migration from legacy systems to new property management platforms.

Reporting

Prepares accommodation schedules based on floor plans, operational data, and stakeholder requirements.
Contributes to budgeting, forecasting, and scenario modelling activities using Excel and other financial tools.
Designs and maintains dashboards, reports, and data visualisations using tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Oversees system performance post-migration to ensure the consistency and quality of data.

Data Management

Maintains and ensures the accuracy of internal and external data sources.
Collaborates with multiple departments to align data insights with business goals.
Uses SQL, Python, or R to extract, manipulate, and analyse data from various systems.
Supports data mapping, cleansing, validation, and system migration activities.
Develops and executes test plans to ensure data reliability and reporting integrity.
Works with IT, finance, operations, and project teams to resolve data-related issues.
Documents data flows, transformation logic, and system integration processes.

Strategic & Ad-Hoc Support

Delivers ad-hoc analytical support to aid in strategic planning and business growth initiatives.
Undertakes additional tasks and project work to support wider commercial and sales objectives.
Demonstrates flexibility and responsiveness to changing business needs.
Candidate Profile
Essential Experience & Skills
A degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or Statistics.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and SQL.
Hands-on experience with visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to present complex data insights to non-technical audiences clearly and effectively.
Capacity to manage multiple tasks and work to tight deadlines

Desirable Experience & Skills

Experience within the student accommodation, property, or hospitality sectors.
Understanding of revenue management or dynamic pricing strategies.
Proficiency in Python or R for automation or advanced data modelling.
Familiarity with CRM or property management systems such as Entrata, StarRez, Salesforce, or Hubspot.
Personal Attributes
A proactive, self-motivated individual who thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Trustworthy, dependable, and capable of managing multiple responsibilities simultaneously.
Detail-oriented with a passion for accuracy and a professional approach to work.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve, and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. We’re deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy, and fun that reverberates throughout the company.

Our extensive learning programs and mentorship opportunities help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means there’s going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. We’re willing to take risks, fail fast, and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.

If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.

About the Role:

As a member of the Editorial team, you will spend each day immersed in the private markets, aiming to help our customers be better investors, advisors, and market participants. The work you will do plays a direct role in the evolution of the industry! 

Everyone on our team is supported by a flexible work environment and a culture that promotes curiosity, collaboration, and professional development. We prioritize recognition and respect across all roles and have a high level of camaraderie. The fast-growing nature of our organization provides ample opportunity to advance in your career and explore what interests you. 

As we continue investing in the talent of our group, our coverage has evolved rapidly over multiple industries and geographies. Our insights are routinely cited by top-tier publications and sought after by prominent players in the financial markets. In addition to publishing timely market insights, we also partner closely with our Product, Engineering, and Data Operations teams to continually enhance our datasets and develop unique tools that have a material impact on our customers’ workflows. There is no better time to join us! 

PitchBook’s Data Analyst works with private markets transaction data to develop meaningful insights into a fascinating industry and power our industry leading private equity, M&A, venture capital, and emerging technology research. In addition, you will leverage your analysis skills to interpret client data requests and deliver packaged analytics used by some of the largest private capital investors, investment banks, and service providers globally. Our team utilizes technical data analysis skills in conjunction with deep financial and private capital markets industry knowledge to deliver the most accurate and digestible information to our clients.

Primary Job Responsibilities:


Utilize strong Microsoft Excel, SQL, and other programming language skills to provide high-quality data analysis and support to clients, internal stakeholders, and select media outlets
Serve as data expert for all use cases that utilize PitchBook’s broad database
Contribute to research and analysis across our core private equity, M&A, venture capital, and emerging technology coverage areas
Work closely with research analysts to identify unique data points to support research, while also identifying unique tables and graphs to clearly illustrate that information
Serve as data expert for all use cases that utilize PitchBook’s broad database
Manage and complete time-sensitive custom research requests for clients
Contribute to and provide data support to broader editorial teams as they develop content for blog posts, data-graphics, and newsletter stories
Manage and respond to inquiries from clients, press, internal colleagues, and the general public regarding data requests and published research
Support the vision and values of the company through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors
Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested



Skills and Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree with a concentration in Finance, Business Administration, or Economics preferred
1+ years of experience in financial services role or experience working with large datasets
Strong understanding of financial concepts such as valuation techniques (discounted cash flow, comps, etc.), internal rate of return, asset allocations, and more
Strong Excel proficiency and experience in SQL is a plus
Experience using Python or other programming languages is a plus
Strong interest in M&A and private financial markets
Critical thinker
Detail oriented with an analytical mindset
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Experience with PitchBook Platform is a plus
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite including in-depth knowledge of Outlook, Word, and Excel with the ability to pick up new systems and software easily



Benefits at PitchBook:

Physical Health


Private medical insurance
Dental scheme
Additional medical wellness incentives
Life cover



Emotional Health


Paid sabbatical program after four years
Paid parental leave
Education subsidies
Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
Minimum 25 days annual leave and volunteer days



Social Health


Employee resource groups
Company-wide events
Employee referral bonus program
Quarterly team building events



Financial Health


10% Pension contribution
Income protection
Shared ownership employee stock program
Transportation stipend
Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.



Working Conditions:

At the heart of our company is a belief in the power of in-person collaboration. Being together in the office fuels our creativity, strengthens our connections, and drives the innovation that sets us apart. Our culture is built on spontaneous moments—those hallway conversations, whiteboard brainstorms, and shared celebrations in each of our global offices—that simply can’t be replicated remotely. This role is expected to be in the office 5 days a week.

The job conditions for this position are in a standard office setting. Employees in this position use PC and phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Limited corporate travel may be required to remote offices or other business meetings and events.

Life At PB:

We are consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work and our culture is at the heart of our success. It’s our fundamental belief that people do and create great things and that people are the cornerstone of prosperity. We believe that proactively seeking out different points of view, listening to others, learning, and reflecting on what we’ve heard creates a sense of belonging within PitchBook and strengthens the PitchBook community.

We are excited to get to know you and your background. Concerned that you might not meet every requirement? We encourage you to still apply as you might be the right candidate for the role or other roles at PitchBook.


Show more
HTML:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve, and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. We’re deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy, and fun that reverberates throughout the company.

Our extensive learning programs and mentorship opportunities help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means there’s going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. We’re willing to take risks, fail fast, and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.

If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.

About the Role:

As a member of the Editorial team, you will spend each day immersed in the private markets, aiming to help our customers be better investors, advisors, and market participants. The work you will do plays a direct role in the evolution of the industry! 

Everyone on our team is supported by a flexible work environment and a culture that promotes curiosity, collaboration, and professional development. We prioritize recognition and respect across all roles and have a high level of camaraderie. The fast-growing nature of our organization provides ample opportunity to advance in your career and explore what interests you. 

As we continue investing in the talent of our group, our coverage has evolved rapidly over multiple industries and geographies. Our insights are routinely cited by top-tier publications and sought after by prominent players in the financial markets. In addition to publishing timely market insights, we also partner closely with our Product, Engineering, and Data Operations teams to continually enhance our datasets and develop unique tools that have a material impact on our customers’ workflows. There is no better time to join us! 

PitchBook’s Data Analyst works with private markets transaction data to develop meaningful insights into a fascinating industry and power our industry leading private equity, M&A, venture capital, and emerging technology research. In addition, you will leverage your analysis skills to interpret client data requests and deliver packaged analytics used by some of the largest private capital investors, investment banks, and service providers globally. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: London - W12 7FW

Mode of working: Hybrid (2 to 3 days in the office)

Duration: 6+ months of contract initially




Job Introduction:




Top Skills

Ability to interpret complex data sets and translate them into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proven experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or commercial reporting role, ideally within a media, digital, or advertising environment.
Familiarity with CRM software (preferably Salesforce)
Experience with data transformation processes using software or code e.g. Alteryx, SQL
Familiarity with the media and advertising industry, especially digital marketing
Exposure to performance analytics tools, e.g. Google Ad Manager
Strong technical skills and proficiency in Excel and Tableau (data manipulation and visualisation)
Able to collaborate and build relationships with the immediate team and with colleagues in wider teams such as Sales, Operations and Finance

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🚨 Data Analyst – Contract | £450–£550pd | Outside IR35 | Hybrid (3 days onsite – Central London)

6-Month Initial Contract | Banking Sector




We’re looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join a challenger banking client on a 6-month contract basis. This role offers the opportunity to work on meaningful projects that inform high-level business decisions across a complex financial environment.




🔍 Key Details:

Rate: £450–£500 per day
IR35: Outside IR35
Duration: 6 months (potential extension)
Location: Central London (3 days onsite, 2 remote)
Sector: Banking/Financial Services




🎯 Key Responsibilities:

Analyse large and complex datasets (e.g., customer behaviour, sales trends, market data)
Create insightful reports, dashboards, and visualisations using tools like Power BI or Tableau
Design and run efficient SQL queries to extract and manipulate data
Develop and maintain BI tools and solutions to support decision-making
Perform data validation and quality control to ensure integrity and accuracy
Deliver ad hoc analysis and actionable insights to stakeholders




💼 Required Skills & Experience:

3+ years in a Data Analyst role within complex business environments
Strong SQL skills and experience with data visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, or similar)
Experience of Python or R would be a plus.
Comfortable working with large datasets and drawing business-relevant conclusions
Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
Experience in the banking or financial sector is a strong plus

Title: Analyst
Description:
Gas Strategies is looking for an ambitious and capable person with an advanced quantitative and analytical ability to join the Consulting Team.




Accurate and precise, with an advanced level of Excel proficiency, the successful candidate will have some experience within the energy industry and will have developed a good understanding of current market dynamics. The role provides the first step on a career path towards a Consultant role in our well-established and successful global professional services consulting firm.




Purpose of Role

Responsible for the delivery of accurate, relevant, and efficient client-focused data analysis, market research, and modelling that exhibits a clarity of understanding of clients’ concerns and supports clients’ commercial decision making. This includes the ability to clearly articulate results and findings, in written and oral presentations, to both colleagues and clients.




Key Performance Indicators & Role Description




Data Modelling

To lead on the building and customisation of economic/commercial models for financial simulation and scenario planning as it pertains to key projects
To support the development and configuration of various in-house tools and models to deliver high value functionality
Develop and improve forecasting/modelling approaches and techniques




Data Management

Use a variety of tasks and methods to organise/analyse data from multiple sources with high degrees of rigour
Use systems and programming knowledge, personal experience, clients’ needs and project goals to provide business decision-making support
Assist with the development and utilisation of Gas Strategies Online products




Data Analysis

Break down issues and tasks into manageable parts in a systematic way and identify relationships between parts
Make the results of analysis understandable, enabling others to buy-in or accept conclusions
Identify, explore, and discuss client needs in order to identify all relevant parameters for inclusion in data models
Discuss and agree the approach to and allocation of project tasks with peers and project managers
Identify data risk elements and assumptions to determine implications and consequences of analysis
Provide technical data modelling assistance to other team members
Understand and interpret underlying research requirements and assumptions in order to identify suitable sources of relevant data
Assist with project delivery through the provision of inputs into presentations and projects
Co-ordinate timely execution and delivery of project outputs as agreed by project timelines




Consulting

Liaise, communicate and network with clients/project leaders to deliver client assignments
Develop good quality project content and reports and oversee quality/evaluation of technical material
Presentation of results and findings to clients




Essential requirements and experience:

Excellent numerate ability with high-level Excel and economic modelling ability
Have a significant background in economic forecasting methods and techniques
Experience of analysing complex data and deriving real business decision support (with tangible benefits to the business)
Have an interest and affinity for the energy and gas industry that is consistent with Gas Strategies Group’s positioning as a key provider of professional services at the heart of the industry
A team player who relishes the challenge of new experiences and exhibits a willingness to seek out opportunities within the business
Ability to quickly learn new concepts and apply these to the wider business context




Desirable requirements:

Have at least 1-2 years’ experience of the energy industry, preferably within the global gas sector
Some exposure to consulting and client interaction would be advantageous




Personal Attributes:

Demonstrate accuracy and meticulous attention to detail
Strong planning, organisational, and time management skills
Creative problem-solving ability
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Social Media Focus)

Location: Southwark, London

Working Model: Hybrid

Salary: £36k Starting Salary




About Goat:

Goat is part of WPP Media (formerly GroupM), the world’s leading media investment company. Since 2015, we've been pioneers in influencer marketing, helping brands leverage the power of social media to achieve real, measurable results. Today, we stand as the global leader in the space, delivering award-winning campaigns across 70+ countries.




As part of our team, you'll collaborate with 500+ social natives worldwide, driving cutting-edge influencer campaigns for some of the most exciting brands. Whether it’s short-term activations or long-term ambassador programs, we treat influencer marketing as a full-funnel channel that drives awareness, engagement, and conversions.




Our data-driven approach is built on insights from tracking over 100,000 influencers and campaign performance. We combine this with expert relationship management, social-first creative strategy, paid media, and advanced tracking, measurement, and optimisation to deliver results that matter.




We’re also proud to be recognised as a recipient of the ‘Top Employer Europe 2024’ certification, underscoring our commitment to fostering a dynamic and supportive work environment. If you’re ready to be part of the team shaping the industry, we’d love to hear from you.




Your responsibilities will include:

Collaborating with Paid and Organic Campaign teams to deliver data-led strategies that optimise performance, improve efficiency, and enhance targeting across live campaigns.
Extracting, cleaning and analysing large-scale social media datasets to uncover patterns, trends and actionable insights that inform campaign planning and decision-making.
Working cross-functionally with campaign managers, strategists and creative teams to embed data-driven thinking throughout campaign execution.
Working with the Campaign Data team to ensure accurate data capture, storage and retrieval, while supporting the evaluation and implementation of tools to improve data workflows.
Communicating complex data findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences, including internal stakeholders and clients.
Continuously monitoring campaign performance, using data to assess effectiveness and recommend opportunities for ongoing optimisation.
Producing clear, insightful reports and dashboards highlighting key trends, performance metrics and strategic recommendations.
Supporting audience development and strategic planning from a data-first perspective, using segmentation and behavioural analysis.




Required experience to apply:

Strong understanding of paid and organic social media, with an analytical mindset and a focus on performance.
Proven experience working with large datasets and translating findings into meaningful insights that inform strategy.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical data and analysis in a simple, engaging way.
Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a social media or digital marketing environment, with a focus on analytics and reporting.




Company Culture and Benefits:

Regular social events and ongoing clubs
Provided MacBook laptop to work from
Flexi-hours
Hybrid Working
£200 grant to make your working from home set up comfortable once you’ve passed probation
Health and wellbeing allowance once you’ve passed probation
Health Insurance after you’ve passed probation
Life Insurance Policy
25 Days Holiday plus bank holidays, accruing up to 30 days based on length of service
Birthday & Work Anniversary Days Off
Length of Service Gifts
In-Office Benefits such as beauty treatments & yoga
Flexible Bank Holidays
Volunteering Days
Free Flu Jabs

Plus many more!

Show more

Title: Research and Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

As a leading group of companies, the ECA International Group stands as a global frontrunner in simplifying international mobility. Our collective vision is to make a positive impact by delivering exceptional products and services to our prestigious list of large enterprise clients.

Our global presence across the UK, EU, Hong Kong, Australia, and the US offers our team a world of opportunities, and our commitment to innovation ensures that you will be at the leading edge of your field.

We love to invest in our people's success and development pathways, creating a diverse and inclusive community where your unique talents shine. Your work here has a global impact, and we prioritise work-life balance, offering flexibility to enable you to perform your best. Join us to experience a rewarding career where your potential is celebrated, and your journey to excellence begins.

About The Role

As a Research Analyst you will be responsible for conducting research, analysing data, and supporting various projects to deliver valuable insights and allowance recommendations for global mobility teams and their international assignees.

With a focus on measuring costs and providing useful guidance for expatriates based in over 500 cities around the world, the Research Analyst supports the Product Analytics teams in gathering, analysing and synthesising data across multiple domains. Additionally, the role involves actively exploring and implementing innovative AI-driven approaches to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of research processes, contributing to the success of the team and wider organisation.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:


Research: Assist in conducting primary and secondary research to gather data on a wide range of costs and issues relating to expatriates around the globe.
Data Collection: Support the collection and organisation of data from various sources, including surveys, reports, and databases, AI and other online sources. Ensure data accuracy and completeness.
Data Analysis: Assist with analysing data using statistical and analytical tools. Support the generation of insights and contribute to clear, data-driven reporting.
Content Generation: Assist in writing reports and articles, preparing presentations and summarising findings, providing insights and recommendations to varied stakeholders.
Market Analysis: Conduct research to identify trends, competitor activities, and emerging opportunities in the global mobility space.
Learning and Development: Actively participate in training and development activities to build research and analytical skills. Seek feedback and guidance to improve performance.
Collaboration: Work closely with team members and other departments to support research projects and ensure alignment with organisational goals.


Qualifications and experience:

Essential:


Demonstrated interest in data analysis and research, supported by relevant coursework, academic projects, or early career experience.
Familiarity with data tools or platforms (e.g. Excel, SQL, or Python), either through education, apprenticeships, or self-directed learning.


Desirable:


A university degree or professional qualification in a relevant field (e.g. Data Science, Data Analyst, Economics, Social Sciences).
Exposure to AI tools, data analytics platforms (e.g. Snowflake), or statistical programming.


Skills and Behaviours:


Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyse data, identify trends and draw conclusions. Familiarity with statistical modelling and analytical techniques is desirable.
Attention to Detail: Meticulous and detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy in data collection and analysis.
Communication Skills: Good written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey findings and deliver insights clearly and concisely.
Technical Proficiency: Knowledge of prompt engineering, generative AI applications, basic coding skills (e.g. Python or SQL) and the Microsoft Office Suite.
Innovative Approach: Creative problem-solving skills to identify opportunities and develop new solutions.
Learning Attitude: Eagerness to learn and adapt, with a proactive approach to seeking feedback and improving skills.
Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively with team members and contribute effectively to group projects.
Global Awareness: A well-informed interest in global issues, current events, and emerging trends.


Benefits

What's in it for you


💼 Enhanced Stakeholder Pension Contribution
🌴 25 days annual leave
🏥 Health, Life Insurance + EAP Wellbeing Support
💰 Eligible for Annual Bonus Scheme
🎉 Long Service Awards
🏋️‍♀️ ClassPass Membership
👶 Enhanced Family Leave
📚 Up to £1,000 per year for personal development & training
🚆 Season Ticket Loan
🏠 Flexible/hybrid Work Environment
🚲 Cycle to Work Scheme
👓 Free Eye Test


Our Team and Culture

We are a super friendly team that thrives on collaboration and supporting each other. We cultivate an environment where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute their best work, helping us to realise our ambitious growth goals and mission.

Our hybrid working structure includes spending around two days a week at our Head Office in Holborn, London. Not to mention, being in the hub of the West End, we're surrounded by many cafes and restaurants and are just a hop, skip, and a jump from the tube.

We love to invest in our people's success and development pathways, creating a diverse and inclusive community where your unique talents shine. Your work here has a global impact, and we prioritise work-life balance, offering flexibility to enable you to perform your best. Join us to experience a rewarding career where your potential is celebrated, and your journey to excellence begins.

About The Role

As a Research Analyst you will be responsible for conducting research, analysing data, and supporting various projects to deliver valuable insights and allowance recommendations for global mobility teams and their international assignees.

With a focus on measuring costs and providing useful guidance for expatriates based in over 500 cities around the world, the Research Analyst supports the Product Analytics teams in gathering, analysing and synthesising data across multiple domains. Additionally, the role involves actively exploring and implementing innovative AI-driven approaches to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of research processes, contributing to the success of the team and wider organisation.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research: Assist in conducting primary and secondary research to gather data on a wide range of costs and issues relating to expatriates around the globe.
  • Data Collection: Support the collection and organisation of data from various sources, including surveys, reports, and databases, AI and other online sources. Ensure data accuracy and completeness.
  • Data Analysis: Assist with analysing data using statistical and analytical tools. Support the generation of insights and contribute to clear, data-driven reporting.
  • Content Generation: Assist in writing reports and articles, preparing presentations and summarising findings, providing insights and recommendations to varied stakeholders.
  • Market Analysis: Conduct research to identify trends, competitor activities, and emerging opportunities in the global mobility space.
  • Learning and Development: Actively participate in training and development activities to build research and analytical skills. Seek feedback and guidance to improve performance.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with team members and other departments to support research projects and ensure alignment with organisational goals.

Qualifications and experience:

Essential:

  • Demonstrated interest in data analysis and research, supported by relevant coursework, academic projects, or early career experience.
  • Familiarity with data tools or platforms (e.g. Excel, SQL, or Python), either through education, apprenticeships, or self-directed learning.

Desirable:

  • A university degree or professional qualification in a relevant field (e.g. Data Science, Data Analyst, Economics, Social Sciences).
  • Exposure to AI tools, data analytics platforms (e.g. Snowflake), or statistical programming.

Skills and Behaviours:

  • Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyse data, identify trends and draw conclusions. Familiarity with statistical modelling and analytical techniques is desirable.
  • Attention to Detail: Meticulous and detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy in data collection and analysis.
  • Communication Skills: Good written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey findings and deliver insights clearly and concisely.
  • Technical Proficiency: Knowledge of prompt engineering, generative AI applications, basic coding skills (e.g. Python or SQL) and the Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Innovative Approach: Creative problem-solving skills to identify opportunities and develop new solutions.
  • Learning Attitude: Eagerness to learn and adapt, with a proactive approach to seeking feedback and improving skills.
  • Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively with team members and contribute effectively to group projects.
  • Global Awareness: A well-informed interest in global issues, current events, and emerging trends.

Benefits

What's in it for you

  • 💼 Enhanced Stakeholder Pension Contribution
  • 🌴 25 days annual leave
  • 🏥 Health, Life Insurance + EAP Wellbeing Support
  • 💰 Eligible for Annual Bonus Scheme
  • 🎉 Long Service Awards
  • 🏋️‍♀️ ClassPass Membership
  • 👶 Enhanced Family Leave
  • 📚 Up to £1,000 per year for personal development & training
  • 🚆 Season Ticket Loan
  • 🏠 Flexible/hybrid Work Environment
  • 🚲 Cycle to Work Scheme
  • 👓 Free Eye Test

Our Team and Culture

We are a super friendly team that thrives on collaboration and supporting each other. We cultivate an environment where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute their best work, helping us to realise our ambitious growth goals and mission.

Our hybrid working structure includes spending around two days a week at our Head Office in Holborn, London. Not to mention, being in the hub of the West End, we're surrounded by many cafes and restaurants and are just a hop, skip, and a jump from the tube.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Insurance – Power BI / DAX / SQL – London hybrid

A prominent London Market insurer is undergoing a major data transformation and is looking for a Data Analyst to join their growing data team.
This is a high-impact role with access to greenfield projects, executive-level stakeholders, and a chance to shape how data is used across the business. You’ll play a key role in educating teams on what's possible and delivering meaningful, visual insights using Power BI, DAX, and SQL.

What You’ll Be Doing:
• Partnering with the business to understand needs and drive data-led decisions • Designing and building cutting-edge Power BI dashboards • Leveraging DAX and SQL to create scalable, performant data models • Contributing to a forward-thinking, collaborative data culture • Driving outcomes and value in transformation projects

What We’re Looking For:
• Proven experience in Data Analysis • Demonstrable value shown from projects ie metrics, how much did the project you worked on save, or create efficiencies etc. • Strong skills in Power BI, DAX, and SQL • ETL tooling and Python preferable • Comfortable engaging stakeholders and translating business needs into solutions • Passion for innovation, education, and impact
Insurance experience needed (general or broker)

Join a company where your ideas matter, your work is visible, and your skills are genuinely valued with a great benefits package.

This role is only open to candidates based in the U.K. with full right to work. Unfortunately this role doesn’t offer sponsorship.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Role: Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid – three days office-based per week)

Department: Data-BI Team

Reports To: Head of Data and Business Intelligence




About Us

We’re Amelco, a UK-based software provider at the forefront of the gaming and gambling industry across the USA, UK, and Europe. We partner with major global gaming companies to build innovative, high-performance platforms that power sportsbooks, lotteries, casinos, virtual games, and financial trading.




Our Vision is to shape the future of gaming and to transform experience from gaming operations into intelligent solutions that meet customer needs in the digital era and create value for all stakeholders in sustainable ways. We value teamwork, knowledge sharing and transparency with accountability. We believe quality, ability and determination are vital ingredients in delivering success at Amelco and that you will be able to instil your imprint with us.




We’re proud of our collaborative and driven culture, and we're excited to be expanding into Australia for the first time—this role marks an important step in our journey.




Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in maintaining and optimizing data workflows, automating processes, and delivering high-quality reports across various business areas, including sportsbook, casino, financial, and bonus reporting.




You will collaborate closely with the engineering team to ensure the smooth integration of automated tools and uphold the accuracy and integrity of data visualizations.




Key Responsibilities

Automate and monitor data workflows to improve efficiency and reduce manual work.
Maintain and optimize existing data tools for accurate and efficient performance.
Collaborate with the engineering team to seamlessly integrate automated tools.
Execute and deliver sportsbook, casino, financial, bonus, and regulatory reports via designated dashboards.
Ensure data visualizations are accurate and comply with reporting standards.
Produce and maintain regulatory reports to ensure industry compliance.
Generate revenue share reports for business stakeholders.
Support the development of new trading and fraud detection tools.
Automate routine reporting tasks to streamline team processes.




Requirements

Proven experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong skills in data visualization tools (preferably Power BI; Tableau also considered).
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and automation.
Experience in automating workflows and data pipelines.
Proficient in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Familiarity with Git and version control principles is a plus.
Ability to work from the London office three days per week.




Salary:

Entry-Level / Junior: £32,500 – £40,000
Mid-Level: £40,000 – £50,000




If this sounds like the opportunity for you, kindly attach a CV to your application for our review. Only applications with a CV will be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data & Insights Analyst
Description:
Data & Insights Analyst - Howden Markets


Join Howden Markets as a Data & Insights Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping our team's strategic decision-making process through data-driven insights.

Are you passionate about data-driven insights that drive strategic impact? Howden Markets is looking for a talented Data & Insights Analyst to join our dynamic London-based team and play a key role in shaping our service delivery to executive internal stakeholders and the global (re)insurance market.

In this pivotal role, you will report directly to the Head of Data & Analytics, working alongside our two other analysts to craft and deliver exceptional analytics solutions. Your insights will empower strategic decision-making and optimize business operations, ensuring Howden Markets remains at the forefront of innovation and excellence.

About Howden Markets and the role

Howden Markets is a fast-paced, globally connected team championing the interests of Howden Broking, Howden Reinsurance and DUAL. We bridge strategy and execution with a data-driven approach at the heart of what we do. It powers intelligent decision-making, drives operational excellence, and shapes our service offering as we continue to build and scale. As a Data & Insights Analyst, you will:

Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to deliver market-leading insights across Howden group's portfolio.
Work closely with Market Management and Group Placement, the two revenue generating business functions within Howden Markets, ensuring that analytics unlock new opportunities and optimise efficiencies.
Lead innovation within our skilled analytics team, building capabilities that drive growth, efficiency, and enhanced service delivery.
Develop, design and embed cutting-edge visual tools that transform complex data into actionable insights, enhancing strategic decision-making.
Play an instrumental role in standardising best practices, optimising processes, and creating impactful data strategies.

At Howden Markets we believe in a culture of collaboration, transformation and growth. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to contribute to meaningful strategic decisions, this role is for you.

Please note this is a hybrid role, requiring 3 days a week in our City of London office.

Key responsibilities:

Support the Head of Data & Analytics by championing and executing the Howden Markets data strategy, ensuring alignment to overall business goals.
Identify opportunities and challenge the norms to develop and maintain high quality reports and dashboards in Power BI and Excel, supporting business decisions for Howden Markets, our internal business stakeholders and our insurer clients.
Translate complex data into actionable insights relevant to clients and the wider Howden business. Build reports to monitor the performance of placement solutions (e.g. Howden facilities and competitive panels), and Howden-insurer portfolios.
Engage with business stakeholders to collect, refine and document report requirements, ensuring clarity and precision.
Be a subject matter expert in Howden Markets data, serving as a key point of contact for the team to ask questions and raise concerns.
Identify and pursue opportunities to automate manual operational processes, enhancing efficiency and productivity.
Create and maintain documentation of all reports and analysis, ensuring accessibility and transparency.
Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders and collaborators (e.g. Group Data, Howden Markets functions, other analytics experts in Howden) fostering teamwork and cooperation.
Support the exploration of emerging AI platforms and opportunities to shape and enhance the team's AI strategy, driving innovation and informed decision-making.

Key Skills, Knowledge & Experience

Advanced Power BI, Power Query and Excel skills.
2+ years of insurance market experience required.
Experience in London Market insurance preferred.
Experience in a Power BI equivalent tool e.g. Tableau or Qlik deemed relevant
Experience in analysing large datasets to assess performance-related KPIs.
Experience in VBA preferred but not essential.
Technically relevant or industry recognised qualifications are a plus (e.g. CII, Microsoft Certifications etc.)
Experience in SQL and Databricks considered a plus

Person Specification:

Analytically minded and a good problem solver. Confident in taking on new challenges independently.
A desire for knowledge and an aspiration to learn the intricacies of the insurance industry.
Curious and collaborative in nature, with great interpersonal skills.
Confident in engaging with a diverse set of stakeholders.
Highly organised, with excellent planning, prioritisation and time management skills

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client are an Insurance consultancy seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst with expertise in Azure Services to play a pivotal role in designing and developing data solutions within their organization.




Role Type: Permanent and Contract Options

Location: London/ Hybrid




Responsibilities

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.




Requirements

Proven working experience as a Business Data Analyst.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, Tableau, Power BI), databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks), and data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Demonstrated analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Experience working with large datasets and distributed computing tools (Hadoop, Spark, etc.)
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, etc.).
Experience with data profiling tools and processes.
Knowledge of Microsoft Fabric is desirable.
Professional experience as a Data Modeler/Data Architect in P&C insurance, preferably reinsurance
Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels.




Good to Have:

Experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Strong understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | 6-Month Contract | London (hybrid) | £400 per day

One of our public sector clients is looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join their Business Intelligence team on a 6-month contract basis.

You'll play a key role in delivering data-driven insights that support commercial strategy and revenue growth across our global advertising sales business. Working with teams across Sales, Marketing, Finance, Operations and Strategy, you'll provide reporting, dashboards, and market intelligence that inform decision-making.

Key Responsibilities


Produce and maintain sales and performance reports
Monitor Salesforce data and pipeline accuracy
Build insightful Tableau dashboards
Conduct market and competitor analysis
Ensure data quality across systems
Support finance with payment tracking
Deliver ad hoc analysis as needed


What You'll Bring


Strong experience in data analysis or BI, ideally in media or advertising
Proficiency in Excel and Tableau
Ability to interpret complex data for varied stakeholders
Familiarity with CRM (Salesforce), SQL, or Alteryx is a bonus
Excellent communication and attention to detail
Graduate or equivalent qualification is required


This is a 6-month contract working hybrid from London 2 or 3 days per week. Offering a day rate of £400 (inside ir35)

This is a great opportunity to apply your analytical skills in a fast-paced, creative environment. If you're passionate about turning data into meaningful insights - we want to hear from you.

Apply today to be considered!

McGregor Boyall is an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on any grounds.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
Zeal Group is one of the leading trading platforms with a focus on developing markets and great plans for international expansion.

At the heart of our company's data-driven strategy lies our Business Intelligence team, a specialized group dedicated to the art and science of data analysis. Our team is the backbone in transforming raw data into a treasure trove of insights, guiding the strategic direction of the company. With a laser focus on identifying and building key indicators for crucial areas within the organization, we strive to help key stakeholders in strategic decision-making.

We are a compact team of data analysts and BI engineers, each with a deep understanding of how data shapes business outcomes. Our expertise spans across various domains, enabling us to craft bespoke analytical solutions that meet the unique needs of different departments. From sales and marketing to operations and finance, our work informs strategies, optimizes performance, and uncovers opportunities for growth and innovation.

In our pursuit of excellence, we leverage cutting-edge BI tools and technologies, ensuring our stakeholders access reliable, timely, and actionable data. Our collaborative ethos fosters a culture of shared knowledge and continuous learning, enabling us to push the boundaries of what is possible with data.

As a Data Analyst/BI Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations. Your mission is to delve deep into the analysis of company indicators, unraveling the stories the data tells to empower business decisions, optimize processes, and drive product innovation. You will:


Analyze company indicators to provide actionable business insights and product improvement recommendations
Develop and own business intelligence solutions, including BI/data visualisation tools, dashboards, and reports to meet business needs
Collaborate with stakeholders as a data business partner, understanding and defining business requirements for data assets
Develop and maintain the semantics layers of the data analytics platform through effective data modelling and data orchestration
Ensure data quality and integrity by establishing and enforcing data governance standards
Create and manage documentation, including technical specifications, data catalog, and other related documents for BI processes, systems, and procedures



Requirements


Fluency in SQL is a must (CTE, Window functions)
Hands-on experience with BI tools, Dashboards, and Data Visualizations (Power BI, Metabase or similar tools)
Proven track record of end-to-end implementation of data analysis projects, from gathering requirements and data processing to effectively presenting insights to stakeholders
Proficient in data modeling, building high quality datasets and products


Nice to have


Proficiency in Data Modelling, building high quality datasets and products
Experience in Python
Experience with DBT, Airflow, Dagster or similar tools
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Spark)
Background in online trading or related financial sectors



Benefits


State-of-the-art technologies (Power BI, Metabase, BigQuery, Dagster, DBT, Datahub, Spark, Python, SQL)
A collaborative and friendly team of professionals
High engineering standards (with a focus on change management and data quality)
Flexible schedule and remote friendliness
Show more

  • Experience in Python
  • Experience with DBT, Airflow, Dagster or similar tools
  • Experience with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Spark)
  • Background in online trading or related financial sectors


Benefits

  • State-of-the-art technologies (Power BI, Metabase, BigQuery, Dagster, DBT, Datahub, Spark, Python, SQL)
  • A collaborative and friendly team of professionals
  • High engineering standards (with a focus on change management and data quality)
  • Flexible schedule and remote friendliness

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a forward-thinking, PE backed organization and have experienced rapid growth over the last 2 years! They are looking to leveraging data to drive strategic decisions and improve outcomes. This role will suit a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join their growing team to support the senior leaders & finance teams to provide better MI visibility to stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and insights.
Create dashboards and reports to support business decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Monitor data quality and ensure data integrity.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in Excel, SQL, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and presentation abilities.
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Graduate Data Analyst – Financial & Legal Data Modelling




£25,000–£35,000 + Bonus | Full-time | Central London (Office-based)

Location: London (Zone 1 – near Charing Cross)

Sector: Analytics | Commercial Disputes | Legal Data | Graduate Roles




We’re working exclusively with a high-performing boutique analytics consultancy that supports legal teams in major commercial disputes. They’re now hiring a Graduate Data Analyst to join their expert team and play a key role in quantifying financial losses, analysing large datasets, and helping deliver evidence-based reports for high-profile cases.




This is a unique opportunity for a numerically gifted graduate to launch their career in an intellectually stimulating and genuinely commercial role. Combining elements of data science, statistical modelling, and financial analytics.




🧠 What you’ll be working on:

Reviewing incomplete, inconsistent datasets and making assumptions to fill data gaps
Preparing clear, auditable Excel-based reports to support financial claims
Writing compelling client-facing reports that communicate your analysis effectively
Collaborating with external parties including law firms, suppliers, and data providers
Using Excel, Word and statistical tools to deliver high-quality work under time pressure




✅ Ideal candidate profile:

Recent graduate (or final-year student) with a 2:1 or above in a quantitative degree
Strong academic track record – target universities include Warwick (MORSE), Imperial, Kings College, LSE, Oxford, or Cambridge
Exceptional numerical skills and strong attention to detail
Comfortable working with incomplete or messy data
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (logical functions, pivot tables, lookups etc.)
Bonus: exposure to Python, R, or other statistical tools




🔎 Interview process:

Stage 1: 10-minute intro interview with the team
Stage 2: In-person 2-hour interview with a case study and presentation
Interviews will begin in early July, with a preference for candidates who can start immediately




💼 The offer:

Salary: £25,000 – £35,000 depending on experience
Full-time, office-based role in Central London
Immediate start preferred (but not essential for strong candidates)
Join a small, smart, collaborative team working on real commercial impact cases




This is an outstanding opportunity to move into high-level analytical work with real-world impact—ideal for numerically gifted graduates looking for more than just a data job.




Apply for immediate consideration.

Show more
